definition: Chinese ash (Fraxinus chinensis), whose bark, flowers and leaves are used in TCM

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: There was an ash tree in the forest which was thought to be a monster.
sentences.chinese: 森林中有一株被認爲是妖怪的白蠟樹。

sentences.english: Sugar maples almost stop growing, and ash seedlings start to thrive.
sentences.chinese: 糖槭樹幾乎不在生長，但白蠟樹苗卻存活下來。

sentences.english: He is asking people to send in ash seeds.
sentences.chinese: 他正要求人們上交白蠟樹的種子。

sentences.english: I knew one years ago who could swear the bark off a frozen ash.
sentences.chinese: 我認識一個人，他可以扒掉一棵冰凍了白蠟樹的樹皮。

sentences.english: The United States Department of Agriculture is working to save the ash tree.
sentences.chinese: 美國農業部一直在拯救白蠟樹方面做工作。
